page.title: 01HOLBROOKS/WHITMORE PARK AREA
page.content: {Debbie Bee aged 11} {Holbrooks}is in the north west of {Foleshill}.Today the area is mostly residential,recreational space and park as well as light industry.Until the Dissolution the land in{Holbrook} belonged to Coventry Priory.{Holbrooks is most probaly named after William Holbrook.A century ago{Keresley ,} {Exhall,Holbrooks,Radford and Whitmore} were little isolated villages and hamlets linked to Coventry by rough lanes that cut across farmlands, commons and patches of moor.There was a lot of wood and also a lot of moor no grass only moss which was white so the place was called{Whitemore.}It was made into a park by the monks. It was waste land and woods the park was known as Whitemore Grange.All that is left is the history and legends of the park,old names,and a few farmhouses.
